sentence.Network_en: They shot him at point blank range with an automatic rifle.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们用自动步枪近距离开枪射杀了他。

sentence.Network_en: He had been gunned down and killed at point-blank range.
He had murdered Perceval at point blank range with a single shot.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在近距离一枪射杀了珀西瓦尔。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: probably from point + blank in the contemporaneous sense 'white spot in the centre of a target'

entry.def: If you say something point-blank, you say it very directly or rudely, without explaining or apologizing.

example.ex: The army apparently refused point blank to do what was required of them...
example.tran: 军队貌似断然拒绝做他们分内的事情。

example.ex: Mr Patterson was asked point blank if he would resign.
example.tran: 帕特森先生被直接问到他是否会辞职。

entry.def: If someone or something is shot point-blank, they are shot when the gun is touching them or extremely close to them.

example.tran: 他近距离朝贝尔纳黛特开了枪。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion;

sentences.sentence: "tell me what you think--and you may just as well be frank"
"it is possible to be outspoken without being rude"

means.word_mean: 2. close enough to go straight to the target;
1. in a direct and unequivocal manner;

sentences.sentence: "I asked him point-blank whether he wanted the job"

sentences.en: He fired the gun from point-blank range.
She gave him a point-blank refusal.
The hunter shot the bear point-blank.
He told us point-blank that his company was on the verge of bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 他直截了当地告诉我们,他的公司快要破产了。
